articles.content:
Committees for remembering Kim Il Sung formed
    Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- A  Danish committee for remembering the President Kim Il Sung was formed in Copenhagen on July 1 on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of his passing away.   A committee for remembering the President was inaugurated on June 26 by the Carcabelos, Portugal, Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.   The committee set a remembering period from June 26 to July 10.

articles.content:
Floral basket from President of Equatorial Guinea 
    Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- A floral basket from President of Equatorial Guinea Obiang Nguema Mbasogo was laid before the statue of the President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill  on Thursday on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of his passing away.   Written on the ribbon hanging from the floral basket were letters "I pray for eternal life of his excellency the great leader Kim Il Sung."

articles.title: Gold medal and diploma to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Gold medal and diploma to President Kim Il Sung
   Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of awarding a gold medal and a diploma to the President Kim Il Sung was held in the city of Chosica, Peru, on July 4.   The ceremony decided to award the gold medal and the diploma to the President for his immortal contributions  to world peace and the accomplishment of the cause of independence.   The mayor of the city handed them to the Korean ambassador to Peru.

Gold medal and diploma to Kim Jong Il
   Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of awarding a gold medal and a diploma to General Secretary Kim Jong Il was held in the city of Chosica, Peru, on July 4.   The ceremony decided to award the gold medal and the  diploma to him for his immortal contributions to world peace and the accomplishment of the cause of independence.   The mayor of the city handed them to the Korean ambassador to Peru.

articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's work published in Cuba
    Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's immortal work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification" was published in book form by Academia Publishing House of Cuba on July 1.   The work, which was made public on August 4, Juche 86 (1997), defines the three principles of national reunification, 10-point program of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Confederal Republic of Koryo  advanced by Kim Il Sung as the three charters of national reunification. It also lays down the tasks to improve the relations between the north and south and open an epochal phase of national reunification.

articles.title: Memorial evening on 5th death anniversary of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Korean people's struggle supported
   Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The stand of the Guinean government toward the DPRK remains unchanged and we express full support to and firm solidarity with all the just measures taken by the DPRK government to realize the independent and peaceful reunification of the country and the efforts of the Korean people to build a powerful nation.    Lamine Sidime, Prime Minister of Guinea, said this on July 1 when he met the government economic delegation of the DPRK headed by Kim Pong Ik, vice-Minister of Foreign Trade, on a visit to guinea.   
   Pointing out that the relations between the two countries are particularly strong ones with a long historic tradition, he expressed the belief that the Korean people would surely achieve the reunification of the country and accomplish the cause of building a powerful nation under the wise guidance of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
   He stressed that the two countries would support and cooperate with each other in the future, too, on the principle of south-south cooperation put forward by the President Kim Il Sung.

articles.content:
Greetings to governor-general of Bahamas
   Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, today sent a message of greetings to Orville Alton Turnquest, governor-general of the Commonwealth of The Bahamas, on the occasion of its Independence Day.   The message wished the governor-general and people of Bahamas  success in their work to achieve the country's progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Mongolian President
articles.content:
Greetings to King of Morocco
   Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, today sent a message of greetings to King Hassan II of Morocco on the occasion of his 70th birthday.   The message wished him greater success in his work for the progress and prosperity of the country as well as his health and happiness.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Japanese guest
articles.content:
Greetings to Mongolian President 
   Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, today sent a message of greetings to President Nachagyn Bagabandy on the occasion of the National Day of Mongolia.   Sending congratulations to the president and people of Mongolia on the National Day, the message wished them wellbeing.   Meanwhile, premier of the cabinet Hong Song Nam and Minister of Foreign Affairs Paek Nam Sun separately sent congratulatory messages to the chairman of the Council of Ministers and the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Mongolia.

Talks held between DPRK and Cambodian foreign ministers
   Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Talks were held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today between the Foreign Minister of the DPRK and the Minister of State of the Royal Government and Concurrently Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Cambodia.   At the talks, both sides exchanged views on further developing the friendly relations between the two countries and on a series of other issues of common concern.   Present there on the Korean side were Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun, DPRK Ambassador E.P. to Cambodia Kim Yong Sop and officials concerned and on the Cambodian side were Minister of State and Concurrently Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation Hor Namhong and Cambodian Ambassador E.P. to Korea Oum Mannorine.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from Syrian delegation
   Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- A gift was presented to General Secretary Kim Jong Il by a delegation of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Syrian Arab Republic visiting the DPRK.   It was handed by head of the delegation Suleyman Haddad, vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs, to Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.
